legendary_resistance_3.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
legendary_resistance_3.desc: If failed save, can choose to succeed instead.

legendary_resistance_2.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
legendary_resistance_2.desc: If failed save, can choose to succeed instead.

legendary_resistance_1.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
legendary_resistance_1.desc: If failed save, can choose to succeed instead.

magic_resistance.name: Magic Resistance
magic_resistance.desc: Advantage on saves vs spells and magic effects.

pack_tactics.name: Pack Tactics
pack_tactics.desc: Advantage on attacks if ally within 5 ft. of target.

keen_smell.name: Keen Smell
keen_smell.desc: Advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

keen_hearing.name: Keen Hearing
keen_hearing.desc: Advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing.

keen_sight.name: Keen Sight
keen_sight.desc: Advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.

sunlight_sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
sunlight_sensitivity.desc: Disadvantage on attacks and Perception in sunlight.

spider_climb.name: Spider Climb
spider_climb.desc: Can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down.

web_sense.name: Web Sense
web_sense.desc: Knows location of creatures touching its web.

web_walker.name: Web Walker
web_walker.desc: Ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

charge.name: Charge
charge.desc: Extra damage if moves 20+ ft. straight toward target.

reckless.name: Reckless
reckless.desc: Advantage on attacks, but attacks against it have advantage.

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.desc: Regains HP at start of turn if alive.

wing_attack.name: Wing Attack (2)
wing_attack.desc: Beats wings. Nearby creatures: DEX save or damage + prone. Can fly half speed.

abi.name: Mucous Cloud
abi.desc: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it DC 14 Constitution save. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

abi.name: Probing Telepathy
abi.desc: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The aboleth 3x tentacle attacks.

act.name: Tentacle
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning.

act.name: Enslave
act.desc:
The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.
Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the save. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the save when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

leg.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: One creature charmed by the aboleth takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The acolyte is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The acolyte has following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (3 slots): bless, cure wounds, sanctuary

res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Air Form
abi.desc: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The elemental 2x slam attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning.

act.name: Whirlwind
act.desc:
in the elemental's space DC 13 Strength save. On a failure, a target takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage and is flung up 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.
If the save is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

act.name: Change Shape
act.desc:
The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).
In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

monsters.name: Androsphinx
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Inscrutable
abi.desc: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The sphinx is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, detect evil and good, detect magic
- 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, zone of truth
- 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, tongues
- 4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement
- 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, greater restoration
- 6th level (1 slot): heroes' feast

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The sphinx 2x claw attacks.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +12 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing.

act.name: Roar
act.desc:
The sphinx emits a magical roar. Each time it roars before finishing a long rest, the roar is louder and the effect is different, as detailed below. within 500 feet of the sphinx and able to hear the roar save.

First Roar. that fails a DC 18 Wisdom save is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Second Roar. that fails a DC 18 Wisdom save is deafened and frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature is paralyzed and can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Third Roar. makes a DC 18 Constitution save. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 (8d10) thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

- 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor*, magic missile
- 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step
- 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fly, lightning bolt
- 4th level (3 slots): banishment, fire shield, stoneskin*
- 5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, scrying, wall of force
- 6th level (1 slot): globe of invulnerability
- 7th level (1 slot): teleport
- 8th level (1 slot): mind blank*
- 9th level (1 slot): time stop
* The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

abi.name: Petrifying Gaze
abi.desc:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 ft. of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 12 Constitution save if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the save at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 ft. of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

The behir 1x bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 ft. of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 ft. of movement, exiting prone.

After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

abi.desc: If the centaur moves at least 30 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The centaur 2x attacks: one with its pike and one with its hooves or two with its longbow.

act.name: Pike
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing.

monsters.name: Chain Devil
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abi.name: Devil's Sight
abi.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The devil 2x attacks with its chains.

act.name: Chain
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if the devil isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 7 (2d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

act.name: Animate Chains
act.desc:
Up to four chains the devil can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razor-edged barbs and animate under the devil's control, provided that the chains aren't being worn or carried.
Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder. When the devil uses Multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature of its own but can't make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the devil is incapacitated or dies.

rea.name: Unnerving Mask
rea.desc: When a creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil, the devil can create the illusion that it looks like one of the creature's departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the creature can see the devil, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be frightened until the end of its turn.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The chimera 3x attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Horns
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Fire Breath
act.desc: The dragon head exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 15 Dexterity save, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Chuul
monsters.lang: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

abi.name: Sense Magic
abi.desc: The chuul senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The chuul 2x pincer attacks. If the chuul is grappling a creature, the chuul can also use its tentacles once.

act.name: Pincer
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the chuul doesn't have two other creatures grappled.

act.name: Tentacles
act.desc: One creature grappled by the chuul must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Clay Golem
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monsters.lang: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

abi.name: Acid Absorption
abi.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

abi.name: Berserk
abi.desc: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

abi.name: Immutable Form
abi.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The golem 2x slam attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

act.name: Haste
act.desc: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saves, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

abi.name: Damage Transfer
abi.desc: While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down). and that creature takes the other half.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

abi.name: Light Sensitivity
abi.desc: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The cloaker 2x attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target's head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 16 Strength check.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Moan
act.desc: within 60 feet of the cloaker that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom save or become frightened until the end of the cloaker's next turn. If a creature's save is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker's moan for the next 24 hours.

act.name: Phantasms
act.desc:
The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear.
Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight.
A duplicate has the cloaker's AC and uses its saves. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a save against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light
3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis
1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The giant 2x morningstar attacks.

act.name: Morningstar
act.desc: Melee: +12 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing.

act.name: Rock
act.desc: Ranged: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution save against being magically petrified. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the save at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

act.name: Club
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Constrict
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can't constrict another target.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Breath Weapons
act.desc:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.
Acid Breath. The dragon exhales acid in an 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide. in that line DC 11 Dexterity save, taking 18 (4d8) acid damage (fail), (half).
Slowing Breath. The dragon exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution save. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.

monsters.name: Couatl
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The couatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, detect thoughts
3/day each: bless, create food and water, cure wounds, lesser restoration, protection from poison, sanctuary, shield
1/day each: dream, greater restoration, scrying

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

abi.name: Shielded Mind
abi.desc: The couatl is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

act.name: Constrict
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

act.name: Change Shape
act.desc:
The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl's choice).
In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +0 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 bludgeoning.

abi.name: Hold Breath
abi.desc: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target

abi.name: Dark Devotion
abi.desc: The fanatic has advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spell casting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith
- 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The fanatic 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Dagger
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +4 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.

abi.name: Dark Devotion
abi.desc: The cultist has advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened.

act.name: Scimitar
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing.

abi.name: Echolocation
abi.desc: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while deafened.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

act.name: Crush
act.desc:
Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.
While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful DC 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

act.name: Darkness Aura
act.desc: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

abi.name: Two-Headed
abi.desc: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The dog 2x bite attacks.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution save against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the save, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

abi.name: Stone Camouflage
abi.desc: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

abi.name: Gnome Cunning
abi.desc: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saves against magic.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: nondetection (self only)
1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self

act.name: War Pick
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Poisoned Dart
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing.

monsters.name: Deva
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Angelic Weapons
abi.desc: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:
At will: detect evil and good
1/day each: commune, raise dead

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The deva 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Mace
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant.

act.name: Healing Touch
act.desc: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

act.name: Change Shape
act.desc:
The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice).
In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone.

abi.name: Elemental Demise
abi.desc: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave
3/day each: create food and water (can create wine instead of water), tongues, wind walk
1/day each: conjure elemental (air elemental only), creation, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The djinni 3x scimitar attacks.

act.name: Scimitar
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice).

act.name: Create Whirlwind
act.desc:
A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a DC 18 Strength save or be restrained by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it.
A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

abi.name: Shapechanger
abi.desc: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

abi.name: Ambusher
abi.desc: In the first round of combat, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

abi.name: Surprise Attack
abi.desc: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The doppelganger 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Read Thoughts
act.desc: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 ft. of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 ft. of wood or dirt, 2 ft. of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The dragon turtle 3x attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can make one tail attack in place of its two claw attacks.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 15 ft. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 15 ft. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

act.name: Steam Breath
act.desc: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. in that area DC 18 Constitution save, taking 52 (15d6) fire damage (fail), (half). Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this.

monsters.name: Dretch
monsters.lang: Abyssal, telepathy 60 ft. (works only with creatures that understand Abyssal)

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The dretch 2x attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (2d4) slashing.

act.name: Fetid Cloud
act.desc: A 10-foot radius of disgusting green gas extends out from the dretch. The gas spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions.

abi.name: Fey Ancestry
abi.desc: The drider has advantage on saves against being charmed, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The drider's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The drider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The drider 3x attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison.

act.name: Longsword
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison.

abi.name: Fey Ancestry
abi.desc: The drow has advantage on saves against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Hand Crossbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The druid is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh
- 1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave
- 2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, barkskin

act.name: Quarterstaff
act.desc: Melee: +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: druidcraft
3/day each: entangle, goodberry
1/day each: barkskin, pass without trace, shillelagh

abi.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
abi.desc: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

abi.name: Tree Stride
abi.desc: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 ft. of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 ft. of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

act.name: Club
act.desc: Melee: +2 to hit (+6 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft. Hit: 2 (1 d4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

act.name: Fey Charm
act.desc:
The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.
Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's save is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.
The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

abi.name: Duergar Resilience
abi.desc: The duergar has advantage on saves against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

act.name: Enlarge
act.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saves with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

act.name: War Pick
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

act.name: Javelin
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +4 hit, 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

act.name: Invisibility

abi.name: Berserk
abi.desc:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

abi.name: Aversion of Fire

abi.name: Ooze Cube
abi.desc:
The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the save.
Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover.
A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful DC 12 Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 (3d6) acid.
The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

abi.name: Transparent
abi.desc: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

act.name: Pseudopod
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) acid.

act.name: Engulf
act.desc:
The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature DC 12 Dexterity save.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed save.
On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is restrained, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 12 Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

abi.name: Stench
abi.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 ft. of the ghast must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

abi.name: Ethereal Sight

act.name: Etherealness

act.name: Horrifying Visage
act.desc: Each non-undead creature within 60 ft. of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4  10 years. A frightened target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

act.name: Possession
act.desc:
One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 ft. of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma save or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.
The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the save or after the possession ends.

abi.desc: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the mouther is doughlike difficult terrain. that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength save or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

abi.name: Gibbering
abi.desc: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom save. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The gibbering mouther 1x bite attack and, if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) piercing. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the mouther.

act.name: Blinding Spittle
act.desc: The mouther spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity save or be blinded until the end of the mouther's next turn.

monsters.name: Glabrezu
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The glabrezu's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The glabrezu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic
1/day each: confusion, fly, power word stun

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The glabrezu makes four attacks: two with its pincers and two with its fists. Alternatively, it 2x attacks with its pincers and casts one spell.

act.name: Pincer
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). The glabrezu has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

act.name: Fist
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Brave
abi.desc: The gladiator has advantage on saves against being frightened.

abi.name: Brute
abi.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The gladiator 3x melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +7 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

act.name: Shield Bash
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength save or be knocked prone.

rea.name: Parry
rea.desc: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

abi.name: Rampage
abi.desc: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +4 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing.

abi.name: Sure-Footed
abi.desc: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saves made against effects that would knock it prone.

act.name: Ram
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Nimble Escape
abi.desc: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

act.name: Scimitar
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing.

act.name: Shortbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Breath Weapons
act.desc:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.
Fire Breath. The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 13 Dexterity save, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage (fail), (half).
Weakening Breath. The dragon exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Strength save or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saves for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

abi.name: Trampling Charge
abi.desc: If the gorgon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gorgon can make one attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

act.name: Gore
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning.

act.name: Petrifying Breath
act.desc: The gorgon exhales petrifying gas in a 30-foot cone. in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the save at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

abi.name: Amorphous
abi.desc: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

abi.name: Corrode Metal
abi.desc:
Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

act.name: Pseudopod
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison.

act.name: Poison Breath
act.desc: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 11 Constitution save, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage (fail), (half).

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

abi.name: Mimicry
abi.desc: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Illusory Appearance
act.desc:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

act.name: Invisible Passage
act.desc: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

monsters.name: Grick
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Stone Camouflage
abi.desc: The grick has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The grick 1x attack with its tentacles. If that attack hits, the grick can make one beak attack against the same target.

act.name: Tentacles
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing.

act.name: Beak
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The griffon 2x attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

act.name: Beak
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing.

monsters.name: Grimlock
monsters.sen: BS 30 or 10 while deafened (blind beyond this radius)

abi.name: Blind Senses
abi.desc: The grimlock can't use its blindsight while deafened and unable to smell.

abi.name: Stone Camouflage
abi.desc: The grimlock has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

act.name: Spiked Bone Club
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) piercing.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +3 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

abi.name: Rejuvenation
abi.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The naga is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, shield of faith
- 2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, hold person
- 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance
- 4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement
- 5th level (2 slots): flame strike, geas
- 6th level (1 slot): true seeing

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target DC 15 Constitution save, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Spit Poison
act.desc: Ranged: +8 to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. Hit: The target DC 15 Constitution save, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Gynosphinx
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Inscrutable
abi.desc: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The sphinx is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation
- 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, shield
- 2nd level (3 slots): darkness, locate object, suggestion
- 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, remove curse, tongues
- 4th level (3 slots): banishment, greater invisibility
- 5th level (1 slot): legend lore

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The sphinx 2x claw attacks.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing.

leg.name: Claw Attack
leg.desc: The sphinx 1x claw attack.

leg.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

leg.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
leg.desc: The sphinx casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The veteran 2x longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

act.name: Longsword
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Heavy Crossbow
act.desc: Ranged: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing.

act.name: Fire Breath
act.desc: The veteran exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 15 Dexterity save, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The harpy 2x attacks: one with its claws and one with its club.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing.

act.name: Club
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning.

act.name: Luring Song
act.desc:
The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 ft. of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom save or be charmed until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated.
While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 ft. away from the harpy, the must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, a target can repeat the save. A creature can also repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's save is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.

act.name: Talons
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 slashing.

monsters.name: Hell Hound
monsters.lang: understands Infernal but can't speak it

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire.

act.name: Fire Breath
act.desc: The hound exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 12 Dexterity save, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Hezrou
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Stench
abi.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the hezrou must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the hezrou's stench for 24 hours.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The hezrou 3x attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The giant 2x greatclub attacks.

act.name: Greatclub
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning.

act.name: Rock
act.desc: Ranged: +8 to hit, range 60/240 ft. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The hippogriff 2x attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

act.name: Beak
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing.

abi.name: Martial Advantage
abi.desc: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 ft. of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't incapacitated.

act.name: Longsword
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing.

monsters.name: Homunculus
monsters.lang: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

abi.name: Telepathic Bond
abi.desc: While the homunculus is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 5 (1d10) minutes and unconscious while poisoned in this way.

monsters.name: Horned Devil
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abi.name: Devil's Sight
abi.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The devil 3x melee attacks: two with its fork and one with its tail. It can use Hurl Flame in place of any melee attack.

act.name: Fork
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution save or lose 10 (3d6) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 10 (3d6). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

act.name: Hurl Flame
act.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 150 ft. Hit: 14 (4d6) fire. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

abi.name: Blood Frenzy
abi.desc: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

abi.name: Water Breathing
abi.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing.

abi.name: Hold Breath
abi.desc: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

abi.name: Multiple Heads
abi.desc:
The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.
At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

abi.name: Reactive Heads
abi.desc: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

abi.name: Wakeful
abi.desc: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +8 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing.

monsters.name: Ice Devil
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abi.name: Devil's Sight
abi.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The devil 3x attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold.

act.name: Wall of Ice
act.desc:
The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or it's a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter.
When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a DC 17 Dexterity save, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage (fail), (half).
The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10-foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature DC 17 Constitution save, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage (fail), (half). The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.

abi.name: Death Burst
abi.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of jagged ice. within 5 ft. of it DC 10 Dexterity save, taking 4 (1d8) slashing damage (fail), (half).

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc: The mephit can innately cast fog cloud, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold.

act.name: Frost Breath
act.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of cold air. in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity save, taking 5 (2d4) cold damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Imp
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abi.name: Shapechanger
abi.desc: The imp can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., climb 20 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

abi.name: Devil's Sight
abi.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the imp's darkvision.

act.name: Sting (Bite in Beast Form)
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make on a DC 11 Constitution save, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Invisibility
act.desc: The imp magically turns invisible until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the imp wears or carries is invisible with it.

monsters.name: Invisible Stalker
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: Auran, understands Common but doesn't speak it

abi.name: Invisibility
abi.desc: The stalker is invisible.

abi.name: Faultless Tracker
abi.desc: The stalker is given a quarry by its summoner. The stalker knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The stalker also knows the location of its summoner.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The stalker 2x slam attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Iron Golem
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monsters.lang: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

abi.name: Fire Absorption
abi.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

abi.name: Immutable Form
abi.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The golem 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning.

act.name: Sword
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) slashing.

act.name: Poison Breath
act.desc: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 19 Constitution save, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +1 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing.

abi.name: Echolocation
abi.desc: The whale can't use its blindsight while deafened.

abi.name: Hold Breath
abi.desc: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing.

abi.name: Brave
abi.desc: The knight has advantage on saves against being frightened.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The knight 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Greatsword
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Heavy Crossbow
act.desc: Ranged: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing.

act.name: Leadership
act.desc: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 ft. of it makes an attack roll or a save. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.

rea.name: Parry
rea.desc: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

act.name: Dagger
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Sling
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Kraken
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, and Primordial but can't speak, telepathy 120 ft.

abi.name: Freedom of Movement
abi.desc: The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

abi.name: Siege Monster
abi.desc: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The kraken 3x tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 23 (3d8 + 10) piercing. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns. If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

act.name: Tentacle
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 30 ft. Hit: 20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

act.name: Fling
act.desc: One Large or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

act.name: Lightning Storm
act.desc: The kraken magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. A target DC 23 Dexterity save, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage (fail), (half).

leg.name: Tentacle Attack or Fling
leg.desc: The kraken 1x tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

leg.name: Lightning Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The kraken uses Lightning Storm.

leg.name: Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Actions)
leg.desc: While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the kraken. other than the kraken that ends its turn there must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution save, taking 16 (3d10) poison damage (fail), (half). A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the kraken's next turn.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. At will: disguise self (any humanoid form), major image 3/day each: charm person, mirror image, scrying, suggestion 1/day: geas

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The lamia 2x attacks: one with its claws and one with its dagger or Intoxicating Touch.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Dagger
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Intoxicating Touch
act.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +5 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saves and all ability checks.

abi.name: Devil's Sight
abi.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the lemure's darkvision.

abi.name: Hellish Rejuvenation
abi.desc: A lemure that dies in the Nine Hells comes back to life with all its hit points in 1d10 days unless it is killed by a good-aligned creature with a bless spell cast on that creature or its remains are sprinkled with holy water.

act.name: Fist
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Lich
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: Common plus up to five other languages

abi.name: Rejuvenation
abi.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The lich is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
- 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave
- 2nd level (3 slots): acid arrow, detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror image
- 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball
- 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
- 5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying
- 6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability
- 7th level (1 slot): finger of death, plane shift
- 8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun
- 9th level (1 slot): power word kill

abi.name: Turn Resistance
abi.desc: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

act.name: Paralyzing Touch
act.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +12 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

leg.name: Cantrip
leg.desc: The lich casts a cantrip.

leg.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The lich uses its Paralyzing Touch.

leg.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom save against this magic or become frightened for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.

leg.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
leg.desc: Each living creature within 20 feet of the lich DC 18 Constitution save against this magic, taking 21 (6d6) necrotic damage (fail), (half).

abi.name: Pounce
abi.desc: If the lion moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

abi.name: Running Leap
abi.desc: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 ft..

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +0 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 piercing.

abi.name: Hold Breath
abi.desc: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The lizardfolk 2x melee attacks, each one with a different weapon.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Heavy Club
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning.

act.name: Javelin
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +4 hit, 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Spiked Shield
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
- 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield
- 2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion
- 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly
- 4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm
- 5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

act.name: Dagger
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +5 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.

abi.name: Death Burst
abi.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of lava. within 5 ft. of it DC 11 Dexterity save, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage (fail), (half).

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of magma.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc: The mephit can innately cast heat metal (spell save DC 10), requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire.

act.name: Fire Breath
act.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of fire. in that area DC 11 Dexterity save, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Magmin
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Death Burst
abi.desc: When the magmin dies, it explodes in a burst of fire and magma. within 10 ft. of it DC 11 Dexterity save, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage (fail), (half). Flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried in that area are ignited.

abi.name: Ignited Illumination
abi.desc: As a bonus action, the magmin can set itself ablaze or extinguish its flames. While ablaze, the magmin sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft.

act.name: Touch
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (2d6) fire. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a target takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the end of each of its turns.
