abi.name: Trampling Charge
abi.desc: If the mammoth moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the mammoth can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

act.name: Gore
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing.

act.name: Stomp
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
abi.desc: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The manticore 3x attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Tail Spike
act.desc: Ranged: +5 to hit, range 100/200 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing.

monsters.name: Marilith
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The marilith's weapon attacks are magical.

abi.name: Reactive
abi.desc: The marilith can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The marilith can make seven attacks: six with its longswords and one with its tail.

act.name: Longsword
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the marilith can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the marilith can't make tail attacks against other targets.

act.name: Teleport
act.desc: The marilith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

rea.name: Parry
rea.desc: The marilith adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength save or be knocked prone.

abi.name: Petrifying Gaze
abi.desc:
When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 ft. of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a DC 14 Constitution save if the medusa isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the save fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the save at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 ft. of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The medusa makes either three melee attacks--one with its snake hair and two with its shortsword--or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

act.name: Snake Hair
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison.

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +2 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The merrow 2x attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or harpoon.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Harpoon
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +6 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength contest against the merrow or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

abi.name: Shapechanger
abi.desc: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn 't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

abi.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
abi.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

abi.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
abi.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

abi.name: Grappler
abi.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

act.name: Pseudopod
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid.

abi.name: Charge
abi.desc: If the minotaur moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength save or be pushed up to 10 ft. away and knocked prone.

abi.name: Labyrinthine Recall
abi.desc: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

act.name: Greataxe
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Gore
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing.

abi.name: Charge
abi.desc: If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength save or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

act.name: Greataxe
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Gore
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing.

abi.name: Beast of Burden
abi.desc: The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

abi.name: Sure-Footed
abi.desc: The mule has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saves made against effects that would knock it prone.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Mummy
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: the languages it knew in life

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and 1x attack with its rotting fist.

act.name: Rotting Fist
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution save or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

act.name: Dreadful Glare
act.desc: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom save against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the save is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Mummy Lord
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: the languages it knew in life

abi.name: Rejuvenation
abi.desc: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The mummy lord is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The mummy lord has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith
- 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon
- 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic
- 4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith
- 5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague
- 6th level (1 slot): harm

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and 1x attack with its rotting fist.

act.name: Rotting Fist
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution save or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

act.name: Dreadful Glare
act.desc: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom save against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the save is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

leg.name: Attack
leg.desc: The mummy lord 1x attack with its rotting fist or uses its Dreadful Glare.

leg.name: Blinding Dust
leg.desc: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the mummy lord. within 5 feet of the mummy lord must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution save or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

leg.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The mummy lord utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the mummy lord that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution save or be stunned until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

leg.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The mummy lord magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the mummy lord, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

leg.name: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The mummy lord magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the mummy lord is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by the mummy lord remain in its possession.

monsters.name: Nalfeshnee
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The nalfeshnee uses Horror Nimbus if it can. It then 3x attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing.

act.name: Horror Nimbus
act.desc: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light. within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee that can see the light must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nalfeshnee's Horror Nimbus for the next 24 hours.

act.name: Teleport
act.desc: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: Night Hag
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, magic missile
2/day each: plane shift (self only), ray of enfeeblement, sleep

abi.name: Night Hag Items
abi.desc:
A night hag carries two very rare magic items that she must craft for herself If either object is lost, the night hag will go to great lengths to retrieve it, as creating a new tool takes time and effort.
Heartstone: This lustrous black gem allows a night hag to become ethereal while it is in her possession. The touch of a heartstone also cures any disease. Crafting a heartstone takes 30 days.
Soul Bag: When an evil humanoid dies as a result of a night hag's Nightmare Haunting, the hag catches the soul in this black sack made of stitched flesh. A soul bag can hold only one evil soul at a time, and only the night hag who crafted the bag can catch a soul with it. Crafting a soul bag takes 7 days and a humanoid sacrifice (whose flesh is used to make the bag).

act.name: Claws (Hag Form Only)
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Change Shape
act.desc: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium female humanoid, or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

act.name: Etherealness
act.desc: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. To do so, the hag must have a heartstone in her possession.

act.name: Nightmare Haunting
act.desc: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

monsters.name: Nightmare
monsters.lang: understands Abyssal, Common, and Infernal but can't speak

abi.name: Confer Fire Resistance
abi.desc: The nightmare can grant resistance to fire damage to anyone riding it.

abi.name: Illumination
abi.desc: The nightmare sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire.

act.name: Ethereal Stride
act.desc: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

act.name: Rapier
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing.

rea.name: Parry
rea.desc: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

abi.name: Amorphous
abi.desc: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

act.name: Pseudopod
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid.

rea.name: Split
rea.desc: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jellies if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

abi.name: Hold Breath
abi.desc: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

abi.name: Underwater Camouflage
abi.desc: The octopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

abi.name: Water Breathing
abi.desc: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

act.name: Tentacles
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 10). Until this grapple ends, the octopus can't use its tentacles on another target.

act.name: Ink Cloud
act.desc: A 5-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the octopus can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

act.name: Greatclub
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Javelin
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +6 hit, 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing.

monsters.name: Ogre Zombie
monsters.lang: understands Common and Giant but can't speak

abi.name: Undead Fortitude
abi.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it Constitution save with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

act.name: Morningstar
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: darkness, invisibility
1/day each: charm person, cone of cold, gaseous form, sleep

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The oni 2x attacks, either with its claws or its glaive.

act.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Glaive
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage in Small or Medium form.

act.name: Change Shape
act.desc: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, into a Large giant, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. The only equipment that is transformed is its glaive, which shrinks so that it can be wielded in humanoid form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its glaive reverts to its normal size.

abi.name: Aggressive
abi.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

act.name: Greataxe
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Javelin
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +5 hit, 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing.

abi.name: Limited Telepathy
abi.desc: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 ft. of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The otyugh 3x attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the save, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

act.name: Tentacle
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13) and restrained until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

act.name: Tentacle Slam
act.desc: The otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the otyugh's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.

abi.name: Flyby
abi.desc: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

act.name: Talons
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 slashing.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The owlbear 2x attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

act.name: Beak
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing.

abi.name: Pounce
abi.desc: If the panther moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the panther can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing.

monsters.name: Pegasus
monsters.lang: understands Celestial, Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Ethereal Jaunt
abi.desc: As a bonus action, the spider can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target DC 11 Constitution save, taking 18 (4d8) poison damage (fail), (half). If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

monsters.name: Pit Fiend
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

abi.name: Fear Aura
abi.desc: Any creature hostile to the pit fiend that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend DC 21 Wisdom save, unless the pit fiend is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creature's save is successful, the creature is immune to the pit fiend's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The pit fiend's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21). The pit fiend can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, fireball
3/day each: hold monster, wall of fire

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The pit fiend makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, one with its mace, and one with its tail.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +14 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) piercing. The target must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution save or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 21 (6d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The poisoned target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +14 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) slashing.

act.name: Mace
act.desc: Melee: +14 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) fire.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +14 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Planetar
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Angelic Weapons
abi.desc: The planetar's weapon attacks are magical. When the planetar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 5d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

abi.name: Divine Awareness
abi.desc: The planetar knows if it hears a lie.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The planetar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20). The planetar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, invisibility (self only)
3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, flame strike, raise dead
1/day each: commune, control weather, insect plague

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The planetar 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Greatsword
act.desc: Melee: +12 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 22 (5d8) radiant.

act.name: Healing Touch
act.desc: The planetar touches another creature. The target magically regains 30 (6d8 + 3) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

abi.name: Hold Breath
abi.desc: The plesiosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target DC 10 Constitution save, taking 5 (2d4) poison damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The bear 2x attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Divine Eminence
abi.desc: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
- 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary
- 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon
- 3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

act.name: Mace
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning.

monsters.name: Pseudodragon
monsters.lang: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

abi.name: Keen Senses
abi.desc: The pseudodragon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

abi.name: Limited Telepathy
abi.desc: The pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 ft. of it that can understand a language.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Sting
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution save or become poisoned for 1 hour. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

abi.name: Tunneler
abi.desc: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The worm 2x attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

act.name: Bite
act.desc:
Melee: +9 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity save or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.
If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

act.name: Tail Stinger
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target DC 19 Constitution save, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Quasit
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Shapechanger
abi.desc: The quasit can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a bat (speed 10 ft. fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., swim 40 ft.), or back into its true form . Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed . It reverts to its true form if it dies.

act.name: Claw (Bite in Beast Form)
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution save or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

act.name: Scare
act.desc: One creature of the quasit's choice within 20 ft. of it must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the quasit is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

act.name: Invisibility
act.desc: The quasit magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Scare, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the quasit wears or carries is invisible with it.

abi.name: Blood Frenzy
abi.desc: The quipper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

abi.name: Water Breathing
abi.desc: The quipper can breathe only underwater.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 piercing.

monsters.name: Rakshasa
vul: piercing from magic weapons wielded by good creatures
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Limited Magic Immunity
abi.desc: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saves against all other spells and magical effects.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion
3/day each: charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion
1/day each: dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The rakshasa 2x claw attacks

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +0 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 piercing.

abi.name: Mimicry
abi.desc: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

act.name: Beak
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 piercing.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire.

act.name: Fire Breath
act.desc: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 13 Dexterity save, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage (fail), (half).

abi.name: Water Breathing
abi.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing.

abi.name: Heated Body
abi.desc: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +11 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the remorhaz can't bite another target.

act.name: Swallow
act.desc:
The remorhaz 1x bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.
If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

act.name: Gore
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The roc 2x attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

act.name: Beak
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing.

act.name: Talons
act.desc: Melee: +13 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can't use its talons on another target.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

abi.name: Grasping Tendrils
abi.desc: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and 1x attack with its bite.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Tendril
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saves, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

act.name: Reel
act.desc: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 ft. straight toward it.

abi.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
abi.desc: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution save against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

abi.name: Damage Transfer
abi.desc: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

act.name: Smother
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Iron Scent
abi.desc: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

abi.name: Rust Metal
abi.desc: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing.

act.name: Antennae
act.desc:
The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 11 Dexterity save to avoid the rust monster's touch.
If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

abi.name: Pounce
abi.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing.

abi.name: Blood Frenzy
abi.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

abi.name: Shark Telepathy
abi.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The sahuagin 2x melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +3 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Salamander
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Heated Body
abi.desc: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 7 (2d6) fire.

abi.name: Heated Weapons
abi.desc: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The salamander 2x attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +7 hit, 5 ft. or range 20 ft./60 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

act.name: Ram
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning.

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1 d6 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Shortbow
act.desc: Ranged: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Sting
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target DC 9 Constitution save, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The scout 2x melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing.

abi.name: Horrific Appearance
abi.desc:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form DC 11 Wisdom save. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial save. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Death Glare
act.desc: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 ft. of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom save against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

act.name: Illusory Appearance
act.desc:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

abi.name: Water Breathing
abi.desc: The sea horse can breathe only underwater.

monsters.name: Shadow
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Amorphous
abi.desc: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

abi.name: Shadow Stealth
abi.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

abi.name: Sunlight Weakness
abi.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saves.

act.name: Strength Drain
act.desc:
Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

abi.name: Lightning Absorption
abi.desc: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The shambling mound 2x slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Engulf
act.desc: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

monsters.name: Shield Guardian
monsters.lang: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

abi.name: Bound
abi.desc: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

abi.name: Spell Storing
abi.desc: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The guardian 2x fist attacks.

act.name: Fist
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning.

rea.name: Shield
rea.desc: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian's amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer's AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

rea.name: Shriek
rea.desc: When bright light or a creature is within 30 feet of the shrieker, it emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The shrieker continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for 1d4 of the shrieker's turns afterward

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Breath Weapons
act.desc:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.
Cold Breath. The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 13 Constitution save, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage (fail), (half).
Paralyzing Breath. The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 15-foot cone. in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Skeleton
monsters.lang: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Shortbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

monsters.name: Solar
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Angelic Weapons
abi.desc: The solar's weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

abi.name: Divine Awareness
abi.desc: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The solar's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 25). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, invisibility (self only)
3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, resurrection
1/day each: commune, control weather

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The solar 2x greatsword attacks.

act.name: Greatsword
act.desc: Melee: +15 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant.

act.name: Slaying Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +13 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant. If the target is a creature that has 190 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or die.

act.name: Flying Sword
act.desc: The solar releases its greatsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of it. If the solar can see the sword, the solar can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 ft. and either make one attack against a target or return to the solar's hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by any effect, the solar is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if the solar dies.

act.name: Healing Touch
act.desc: The solar touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 (8d8 + 4) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

leg.name: Teleport
leg.desc: The solar magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see.

leg.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The solar emits magical, divine energy. of its choice in a 10 -foot radius DC 23 Dexterity save, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage (fail), (half).

leg.name: Blinding Gaze (Costs 3 Actions)
leg.desc: The solar targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or be blinded until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.

monsters.name: Specter
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

abi.name: Incorporeal Movement
abi.desc: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

act.name: Life Drain
act.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution save or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 9 Constitution save or take 2 (1d4) poison.

abi.name: Rejuvenation
abi.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

abi.name: Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

- Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost
- 1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, sleep
- 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, hold person
- 3rd level (3 slots): lightning bolt, water breathing
- 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door
- 5th level (2 slots): dominate person

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target DC 13 Constitution save, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Longsword
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 1 slashing.

act.name: Shortbow
act.desc: Ranged: +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution save or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its save result is 5 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

act.name: Heart Sight
act.desc: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature's current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 10 Charisma save, the sprite also knows the creature's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the save.

act.name: Invisibility
act.desc: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

abi.name: Cunning Action
abi.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

abi.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
abi.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The spy 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Shortsword
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

act.name: Hand Crossbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing.

abi.name: Death Burst
abi.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. within 5 ft. of the mephit must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity save or take 4 (1d8) fire.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc: The mephit can innately cast blur, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire.

act.name: Steam Breath
act.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of scalding steam. in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity save, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage (fail), (half).

act.name: Blood Drain
act.desc:
Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss.
The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

abi.name: Stone Camouflage
abi.desc: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The giant 2x greatclub attacks.

act.name: Greatclub
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 15 ft. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning.

act.name: Rock
act.desc: Ranged: +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength save or be knocked prone.

rea.name: Rock Catching
rea.desc: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful DC 10 Dexterity save, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

monsters.name: Stone Golem
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
monsters.lang: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

abi.name: Immutable Form
abi.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The golem 2x slam attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning.

act.name: Slow
act.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 ft. of it. Each target DC 17 Wisdom save against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light
3/day each: control weather, water breathing

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The giant 2x greatsword attacks.

act.name: Greatsword
act.desc: Melee: +14 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing.

act.name: Rock
act.desc: Ranged: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning.

act.name: Lightning Strike
act.desc: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. within 10 feet of that point DC 17 Dexterity save, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage (fail), (half).

monsters.name: Succubus/Incubus
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Telepathic Bond
abi.desc: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

abi.name: Shapechanger
abi.desc: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

act.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing.

act.name: Charm
act.desc:
One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom save or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

act.name: Draining Kiss
act.desc: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target DC 15 Constitution save against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage (fail), (half). The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

act.name: Etherealness
act.desc: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

abi.name: Echolocation
abi.desc: The swarm can't use its blindsight while deafened.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 5 (2d4) piercing damage, or 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc:
Melee: +3 hit, 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points by a swarm of centipedes is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target DC 10 Constitution save, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage (fail), (half).

abi.name: Blood Frenzy
abi.desc: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny quipper. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

abi.name: Water Breathing
abi.desc: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +2 hit, 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny raven. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Beaks
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

abi.name: Swarm
abi.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

act.name: Bites
act.desc: Melee: +3 hit, 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Tarrasque
imm: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

abi.name: Reflective Carapace
abi.desc: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

abi.name: Siege Monster
abi.desc: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +19 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +19 hit, 15 ft. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing.

act.name: Horns
act.desc: Melee: +19 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) piercing.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +19 hit, 20 ft. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength save or be knocked prone.

act.name: Frightful Presence
act.desc: of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom save or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

act.name: Swallow
act.desc:
The tarrasque 1x bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.
If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.

leg.name: Attack
leg.desc: The tarrasque 1x claw attack or tail attack.

leg.name: Move
leg.desc: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

leg.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The tarrasque 1x bite attack or uses its Swallow.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The thug 2x melee attacks.

act.name: Mace
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning.

act.name: Heavy Crossbow
act.desc: Ranged: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing.

abi.name: Pounce
abi.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +5 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing.

abi.name: False Appearance
abi.desc: While the treant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

abi.name: Siege Monster
abi.desc: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The treant 2x slam attacks.

act.name: Slam
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning.

act.name: Rock
act.desc: Ranged: +10 to hit, range 60/180 ft. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning.

act.name: Animate Trees
act.desc: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

act.name: Spear
act.desc: Melee or Ranged: +3 hit, 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

abi.name: Trampling Charge
abi.desc: If the triceratops moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the triceratops can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

act.name: Gore
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) piercing.

act.name: Stomp
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The troll 3x attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Claw
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The tyrannosaurus 2x attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) piercing. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

act.name: Tail
act.desc: Melee: +10 hit, 10 ft. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning.

abi.name: Innate Spellcasting
abi.desc:
The unicorn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace
1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle

abi.name: Magic Weapons
abi.desc: The unicorn's weapon attacks are magical.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The unicorn 2x attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

act.name: Hooves
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning.

act.name: Horn
act.desc: Melee: +7 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing.

act.name: Healing Touch
act.desc: The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

act.name: Teleport
act.desc: The unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 ft. of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

leg.name: Hooves
leg.desc: The unicorn 1x attack with its hooves.

leg.name: Shimmering Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
leg.desc: The unicorn creates a shimmering, magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the unicorn's next turn.

leg.name: Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions)
leg.desc: The unicorn magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points.

monsters.name: Vampire, Vampire Form
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: the languages it knew in life

abi.name: Shapechanger
abi.desc:
If the vampire isn't in sun light or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.
While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saves, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

abi.name: Misty Escape
abi.desc:
When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.
While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

abi.name: Vampire Weaknesses
abi.desc:
The vampire has the following flaws:
Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.
Stake to the Heart. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The vampire 2x attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

act.name: Unarmed Strike
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 18).

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +9 hit, 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

act.name: Charm
act.desc:
The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 ft. of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom save against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bit attack.
Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

act.name: Children of the Night
act.desc: The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The werewolf 2x attacks: two with its spear (humanoid form) or one with its bite and one with its claws (hybrid form).

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution save or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

act.name: Claws
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing.

monsters.name: Wight
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
monsters.lang: the languages it knew in life

act.name: Multiattack
act.desc: The wight 2x longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

act.name: Life Drain
act.desc:
Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution save or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

act.name: Longsword
act.desc: Melee: +4 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

act.name: Longbow
act.desc: Ranged: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing.

monsters.name: Will-o'-Wisp
res: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
monsters.lang: the languages it knew in life

abi.name: Consume Life
abi.desc: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 ft. of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution save against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

abi.name: Ephemeral
abi.desc: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

abi.name: Incorporeal Movement
abi.desc: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

abi.name: Variable Illumination
abi.desc: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

act.name: Shock
act.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +4 hit, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning.

act.name: Invisibility
act.desc: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

abi.name: Snow Camouflage
abi.desc: The wolf has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

act.name: Bite
act.desc: Melee: +6 hit, 5 ft. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength save or be knocked prone.

act.desc: The wolf exhales a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. in that area DC 12 Dexterity save, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage (fail), (half).

The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

act.name: Create Specter
act.desc: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

Slowing Breath. The dragon exhales gas in a 30-foot cone. in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution save. On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.
